habitat_description:
In The United States, this species occurs in Texas. In Mexico, the range extends through southern Tamaulipas, central Nuevo Leon, and San Luis Potosi (Bartlett and Bartlett 1999, Conant and Collins 1991). The habitats of this species are described as shrubland, chaparral, suburban/orchard, and to include hardwood woodland (Bartlett and Bartlett 1999). This species can be found in extreme southern Oklahoma, east central Texas to the Gulf Coast, Coahuila, north into the Big Bend region of Texas and ending below the caprock of northwest Texas (Jones and Lovich 2009).

SW-	Mesquite, oak, and other trees, as well as on buildings, fences, and bridges.
